definitions: in support of or showing preference for something
to the advantage or benefit of someone in a situation
examples: I'm in favor of the proposal
The vote was in favor of change
The ruling was in favor of the plaintiff
The odds are in favor of success

definitions: about or on the subject of something being discussed
causing worry or anxiety about something that might happen
examples: I have questions concerning the contract
The report concerning safety was released
There are rumors concerning layoffs
The news concerning his health is worrying

definitions: in answer to or as a reply to something said or done
as a reaction to something that has happened or been done
examples: In response to your letter
She nodded in response to his question
In response to criticism, they changed policy
Prices rose in response to demand

definitions: up to a particular time and no longer; until
as far as a particular place or point
examples: Wait till tomorrow to decide
The shop is open till midnight
Walk till you reach the bridge
Count till you get to ten

definitions: disagreeing with or disapproving of something or someone
in contrast or comparison with something different
examples: I'm opposed to the new rules
Many are opposed to the plan
Work as opposed to leisure
Fact as opposed to fiction

definitions: in addition to someone or something; as well as
apart from or except for someone or something mentioned
examples: Besides English, she speaks French
Who else is coming besides John?
Besides the cost, it's too far
I have nothing besides this

definitions: with regard to or concerning a particular aspect or detail
in relation to or as regards a particular matter
examples: With respect to your question
In respect of the new policy
She's lucky with respect to her health
Changes with respect to working hours

definitions: close to the side of something or someone; beside
working or existing together with someone or something
examples: The boat moored alongside the pier
She walked alongside her friend
He works alongside experienced colleagues
Modern buildings stand alongside historic ones

definitions: surrounded by or in the middle of things or people
happening during a particular situation or set of events
examples: She stood amid the ruins
Find peace amid the chaos
Amid growing concerns, the meeting continued
The decision came amid protests

definitions: representing someone or speaking for them in official matters
for the benefit or advantage of someone; in someone's interest
examples: Speaking on behalf of the company
I'm calling on behalf of Mr. Smith
Acting on your behalf
Donations on behalf of the charity
